title: Momentum and Impulse - two blocks pushed by spring

content.description:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

Blocks <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, of masses <math alttext="4 M" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>M</mi></math> and <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, respectively, slide across a horizontal surface with constant speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math>. A compressed spring of negligible mass is between the blocks, but a string between the blocks prevents the spring from pushing the blocks apart, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. As the blocks move, the string breaks and the blocks are pushed away from each other by the spring. After the spring loses contact with the blocks, Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is at rest and Block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is moving to the right.

Represent an arrow of zero length by drawing a dot at zero.
